response.answer_text: The GP recommends that at the age of 13 they should exercise each day or at least 3 days a week for at least an hour of at least moderate physical activity. This could entail the following: 10 Squats 3 times with a 20-second interval between.10 push-ups also 3 times with 20-second intervals10 back extensions on the floor 3 times with 20-second intervalsThis all depends on how fit the child is. have you tried the following websites www.livestong.com http://didshealth.org

They should be active daily. Whether that is formal exercises, tree climbing, bike riding, lawn mowing, or chasing butterflies? really doesn't matter, though a variety is best. more than exercising, I think kids need to hang on to the idea of physical play, of being rambunctious and letting themselves run amok… too many kids lose that as they hit their teens, and they just freeze in place.
